cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 60 mi south of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to move west-northwest into the eastern Gulf of Mexico Monday, slow and turn northwest Tuesday, then arc northeast toward the Florida Big Bend coast mid-week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (near Cedar Key area)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast from the Keys northward through the Big Bend, then inland across GA/SC
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34-39+ mph) possible by late Wednesday/Thursday with 18 % cumulative probability
weather_observation.storm_surge: No official surge forecast issued in Advisory 1, but minor coastal inundation could develop if the system strengthens while offshore
weather_observation.rainfall: 1â€“4 inches with isolated 6 inches possible through Wednesday, creating risk of localized flooding at the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: Occasional squalls, lightning, and brief tornado threat in outer rainbands
